perturbation.original_text: 12.2.12 all Product supplied to ETON by Aucta or its contract manufacturer shall: (i) meet the applicable Specifications at the time of shipment; (ii) meet regulatory requirements of any relevant regulatory authority in the Territory and Territory of Manufacture; (iii) be manufactured, packaged, tested, stored and shipped in accordance with applicable GMP, the Dossier, Applicable Law and this Agreement; (iv) not be adulterated or misbranded under the U. S. Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act or any other relevant laws and regulations as amended from time to time; and (v) be produced, packaged, tested and stored in facilities that have been approved by applicable regulatory authorities to the extent required by Applicable Laws;
perturbation.changed_text: 12.2.12 all Product supplied to ETON by Aucta or its contract manufacturer should endeavor to: (i) meet the applicable Specifications at the time of shipment; (ii) generally meet regulatory requirements of relevant regulatory authorities in the Territory and Territory of Manufacture; (iii) be manufactured, packaged, tested, stored and shipped with consideration for applicable GMP, the Dossier, Applicable Law and this Agreement; (iv) avoid being adulterated or misbranded under the U. S. Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act or any other relevant laws and regulations as amended from time to time; and (v) be produced, packaged, tested and stored in facilities that aim to be approved by applicable regulatory authorities to the extent required by Applicable Laws;
perturbation.explanation: This change weakens the legal obligation by replacing 'shall' with 'should endeavor to,' 'meet' with 'generally meet,' 'in accordance with' to 'with consideration for', 'not be' to 'avoid being,' and 'have been approved' to 'aim to be approved'. This creates ambiguity and makes compliance discretionary rather than mandatory. This directly contradicts the U.S. Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, which requires strict adherence to GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices) and other regulatory requirements to ensure product safety and efficacy.
perturbation.contradicted_law: U.S. Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act; 21 CFR Parts 210 and 211 (Good Manufacturing Practice regulations)
